author: Special Correspondent
text:
Supported by National Jute Board, a four-day jute expo-cum-sale began here on Wednesday at the V.S. Chellam Hall in Kamarajar Salai.

As many as 20 entrepreneurs from states including West Bengal, Kerala and Uttar Pradesh were participating in the expo displaying their jute products such as jewellery, wall hangings, footwear and other gift articles manufactured and designed in a novel way.

To promote aspirants to take up jute products manufacture, the NJB has also planned to conduct buyer-seller meet on the occasion, which would facilitate learning more about jute, which was eco-compatible.

Jute products were made of natural fibre and the expo would act as a platform to the visitors as well. For more details on the government schemes, log on towww.jute.com.

The expo will be open from 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.
title: Jute expo in Madurai
